## Description

The **Management Triggers** component provides triggers that facilitate executing an integration as part of a setup or management task.

## Triggers

<div id="instancedeploy" />

### Instance Deploy

Executes a Flow when an Instance is deployed | <small><b>key: instanceDeploy</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable inputs={[]} />

Flows that use the **Instance Deploy** trigger are executed whenever an instance is configured and deployed.

This trigger is handy if your integration needs to complete a series of tasks when it is deployed.
For example, your integration might need to configure webhooks in a third-party app so they start to send data to its other flows' endpoints.
Or, your integration might need to enable features in a third-party app or create a series of directories in a file share before the integration is invoked.

You can also use this trigger book keeping - you could alert your team or your app's API when an instance is enabled.

:::tip Deploy-triggered flows should be idempotent
Note that this trigger fires whenever an instance is configured and deployed.
If a customer changes a config variable value and redeploys the instance, or bumps integration version, the flow runs again.

The steps in this flow should be [idempotent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idempotence) (meaning they can safely be run again).
Steps that configure webhooks in a third-party app should check to see if the webhooks already exist, for example, and "create or update" the webhooks instead.
:::

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="instanceremove" />

### Instance Remove

Executes a Flow when an Instance is removed | <small><b>key: instanceRemove</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable inputs={[]} />

Flows that use the **Instance Remove** trigger are executed whenever an instance is deleted.

This trigger is useful for undoing things that an [Instance Deploy](#instance-deploy)-triggered flow set up.
You can remove webhook configuration from third-party apps.
Or, you can alert your team or your app's API that the instance has been removed for book-keeping purposes.

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="userlevelconfigdeploy" />
